sentences.en: Additive variance was higher than dominance variance, which indicates quantitative inheritance.
sentences.cn: 加性的变异高于显性的变异, 表明是数量遗传.

sentences.en: As long as your interests and mine were at variance I could give you no counsel on this subject.
sentences.cn: 只要你我的利益有冲突,我就不能在这个问题上向你提出任何忠告.

sentences.en: Energy ( variance ) of the small - scale motions is not homogeneous.
sentences.cn: 小尺度运动的能量 ( 偏差 ) 是不均匀的.

sentences.en: In statistical language , this estimate is called the between - column variance.
sentences.cn: 在统计学中这个估计值叫组间方差.

sentences.en: It is unnatural for brothers to be at variance.
sentences.cn: 兄弟之间不睦是不近人情的.

sentences.en: Jill and Sue are at variance ( with each other ) over / about their lodger.
sentences.cn: 吉尔和休在对待房客的问题上 ( 彼此 ) 意见不和.

sentences.en: Many of his statements were at variance with the facts.
sentences.cn: 他的说法有很多和事实不符。

sentences.en: My ideas are at variance with his.
Only the additive genetic variance is transmissible by seed.
sentences.cn: 仅仅加性遗传方差是由种子遗传的.

sentences.en: The facts are at variance with your story.
sentences.cn: 事实和你的故事有出入

sentences.en: The political situation there was equally at variance with our preconceptions.
sentences.cn: 那里的政治形势也同样与我们事先的想法不符.

sentences.en: The positive square root of the variance is called the standard deviation.
sentences.cn: 方差的正的平方根叫做标准差.

sentences.en: The question of woman suffrage sets them at variance.
sentences.cn: 妇女参政的问题使他们发生争执.

sentences.en: This idealistic concept is at variance with reality.
sentences.cn: 这种理想主义的观念和现实相矛盾。

sentences.en: Tradition and culture are often at variance with the needs of modern living.
sentences.cn: 传统和文化常常与现代生活的需要有冲突。

sentences.en: We cannot suit; we are ever at variance.
sentences.cn: 我们合不拢, 我们始终是有分歧的.

sentences.en: We have never had a variance with our neighbors.
sentences.cn: 我们从未和邻居发生过一次龃龉.

words.tran_cn: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
可变性，变化性；[生物][数] 变异性
[数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
变化；[生物] 变异，变种
[生物]变异；变化；不一致；分歧；[数]方差

phrases.tran_cn: 处于相异的状态的；与…不同的
误差方差；误差变量；误差偏差
方差比，变异比；变异刺激

trans.tran_cn: 变化，变动，不一致，分歧，<数>方差
trans.tran_en: the amount by which two or more things are different or by which they change
